snippet: Recent earnings reports from the television distributors have contributed to the growing speculation among industry analysts about the declining number of cable subscribers.
abstract: DirecTV posts second-quarter profit of $660 million, or $1.18 a share, down from $711 million, or $1.09 a share, in same period year earlier; Time Warner Cable posts second-quarter profit of $481 million, or $1.64 a share, up from $452 million, or $1.43 a share, in period year earlier; both companies post significant subscriber losses.
lead_paragraph: Recent earnings reports from the television distributors have contributed to the growing speculation among industry analysts about the declining number of cable subscribers.

headline.main: Although Revenue Rises, Subscribers Drop DirecTV and Time Warner Cable
headline.print_headline: Although Revenue Rises, Subscribers Drop DirecTV And Time Warner Cable
